content:
Thoughts on the following?

someone else with a status

you with a status
For other people, I agree with your mockup, @Rishi Gupta (and yeah, maybe another HR below it).

For yourself, I kinda feel like we should just bite the bullet and create the "me" widget. And maybe that widget shows a tiny avatar of yourself, with the green/empty circle, and the status text. And if you click on it, you get a tighter menu (no avatar) that lets you do various "me" things (including PM to yourself).

just to make sure I'm understanding correctly, would the main difference basically be no big avatar?
(Also, figured out how to add the <hr>, and replaced the image with an updated one)

I think it would be like this:

  • remove "me" from buddy list
  • create a "me" a section just above "USERS" with avatar, circle, name, and status text that is clickable
  • that launches user menu
  • remove avatar from user menu (since you see your avatar all the time)
  • add "PM to self" (since click no longer does it)
  • have options to edit avatar, edit status text
ah, got it
That design lgtm; I think we should integrate that to get the "user status" feature looking acceptably and then think about Steve's proposals as a follow-up?
cool, opened as #11459

I think it would be like this:
* remove "me" from buddy list
* create a "me" a section just above "USERS" with avatar, circle, name, and status text that is clickable
* that launches user menu
* remove avatar from user menu (since you see your avatar all the time)
* add "PM to self" (since click no longer does it)
* have options to edit avatar, edit status text

So are we not going with design of: open user info if you click on your name in buddylist https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/11439 ?
I created a PR for that design. If we are dropping that idea I would like to take up task of implementing the new idea. Do mention me if you create an issue for the latest suggested design
@Mohit Gupta Sorry, I should have mentioned that earlier, since I knew you were working on it.
I think in light of what Rishi merged, your current task still makes sense as an incremental approach, so it's probably worth completing that PR.

But it would be good to have you experiment a bit with my idea. (I don't know exactly what the design should be, so I would go in with the attitude and expectation that we might have to iterate a bit on your original designs, but having something concrete to look at would be helpful.)
@Rishi Gupta Do you agree with that plan?
BTW #11441 looks good--basically a five line patch. @Rishi Gupta You may want to test it out just to make sure it works for you.

good question. Now that I play with it I'm ambivalent on including it without any other styling changes.
I'd be curious for @Boris Yankov's opinion if you have an easy way of testing things in the webapp.
(though afk for 40 min or so)
Ok, I added a note to the PR linking back here. @Mohit Gupta I encourage you to at least play around with some design ideas, but you're also welcome to move on to another issue while we decide here.

@Rishi Gupta I don't think that this is necessarily an improvement in isolation (the 5-line change of #11441 )
On the other hand the suggestions of @Mohit Gupta previously sound like moving in exacrtly the right direction.
I have always thought our upper bar should look more like GitHub's.

Significant improvements IMHO:

  • the icon in the upper right corner should be 'own avatar' and dropping down a menu that is mostly related to account
  • the drop-down be shortened, I think we are only adding visual noise
  • Keyboard shortcuts / Message formatting / Search operators are opening the same modal, we can do that with a single item
  • the next 4 options should be hidden behind a 'Help' menu or something similar

I think we are mostly adding UI elements without removing any...
Some might be thinking that the saying 'users don't read' is an exaggeration, but I can assure you I have successfully ignored half of the menu items until now, when I decided to discuss them.

Ok, I added a note to the PR linking back here. @Mohit Gupta I encourage you to at least play around with some design ideas, but you're also welcome to move on to another issue while we decide here.

I have the remove stars issue pending and working on it right now. But I will definitely would like to quickly implement some design ideas you all are discussing and send screenshots. But I feel right now I should wait for a consensus for this discussion.

I think there's some benefit in distinguishing gear menu tasks from more everyday-usage kind of tasks. For example, I don't think "Settings" and "View messages sent by me" should be in the same menu. But I do think it's hard to know where to draw the line. Like "edit profile" is something I never, ever do, so it feels like clutter to me in the popup menu.
I agree we should display avatar in front of the current user.
Also move stuff like "message sent by me" to the left side bar in the filters.

Also move stuff like "message sent by me" to the left side bar in the filters.

I don't understand what you mean by that.
Oh, like a new dedicated link?
Yes move the "view message sent" link to left sidebar.
and name it something like "Messages sent by me"
I really don't see that link's point for current user. For other users it makes sense.
I use it to scan back and find messages I sent earlier in the day.
exactly this should be somewhere more accessible for the current user. Not hidden away in a popover.
I had to find my messages I had to use search bar. I didn't even know that such a link was even in user popover. I saw it while going over this discussion.
I don’t think it quite deserves main screen real estate.

I don’t think it quite deserves main screen real estate.

That's also fine as zulip's search bar is pretty great. So it was not much of an issue when I faced it
I almost never use the search bar, I go to sidebars and user menus mostly.

I almost never use the search bar, I go to sidebars and user menus mostly.

Do zulip use any tools like hotjar to analyze how users use the web interface. Hotjar like tools will actually help in making good design decisions based on real data
We don’t. Having a bit more data would occasionally be nice.

I think it would be like this:
* remove "me" from buddy list
* create a "me" a section just above "USERS" with avatar, circle, name, and status text that is clickable
* that launches user menu
* remove avatar from user menu (since you see your avatar all the time)
* add "PM to self" (since click no longer does it)
* have options to edit avatar, edit status text

Also so what's the consensus of this and other suggestions ? How should I proceed ? BTW I have squashed the commits of my PR into one
I don’t think we’re gonna reach perfect consensus.
I am in favor of some kind of lightweight prototype to help move the conversation forward.

I think mock-ups (e.g. photoshop) are also fine.
There are a large number of decisions to make here though, so I wouldn't expect consensus any time soon
I agree with Boris that we should add an "own avatar" to the upper right corner (maybe replacing the gear? not sure), and also remove many of the current menu items regardless of what else we do.
A variation on mock-ups is to do just do quick hacks on the html/css and send screenshots or screen vids.
Most of the gear menu cruft is about user help.

I think mock-ups (e.g. photoshop) are also fine.
There are a large number of decisions to make here though, so I wouldn't expect consensus any time soon

I will try to complete my PR for some pending issues in a few days and get back will try to make mockups for designs
It would be nice to consolidate that somehow.

yeah, I think it's a combination of user help (which should just appear in the places where it's needed) and advertising features like API docs which I think the zulipchat.com homepage now does a good enough job of
I honestly don’t think it’s horribly broken.
If you want feature A to be discovered more easily, it inevitably makes feature B harder to find.
And people do read stuff. It’s why we support like 15 translations.
Even though I kinda know where most things are in the app, if I change the language settings even to a language that I am semi literate in, I am lost.
